attributes.additional_details: There is great public transport in London but outside London it is cheaply run
attributes.background: Nationalise TFL and not have councils run public transport cheaply.

rejection.details:
Transport for London is already a publicly owned transport operator, owned by the Greater London Authority.

It's not clear if you want the Government to make changes to how public transport operates in London, or the rest of the country.

The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for Transport for London. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly. The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

If you wan the Government to take action in relation to public transport in the rest of England we may be able to accept a petition on this, but you'd need to be clear what you want the Government to do.
